trans:
Slide 2: these are the projects currently in their portfolio and those that are actively in progress.
Slide 3: these are the cable works that are coming and that they want to do with us (2nd half of 2026)
Slide 4: Demar has 2 firms (Demar and Evya) and this is an overview of what has been billed, still has to be invoiced and what is in progress for the different works in progress)
Slide 5: this is an overview of all expired invoices that Pemex still has to pay them (80,932 million USD) and for which they still have to receive certificates – COPADES – so that they can invoice (72,882 mio USD). In addition, they are trying to get a loan from the state bank Nafinsa of 30 million USD in exchange for the outstanding payments to provide their cash flow
Slide 6: is their installment proposal:
Proposal at 18 months and at 24 months (the latter is their preference)
Interest 8% on outstanding amount
If their cash flow turns out to be more positive than expected, they will pay earlier
Start of payments 15/12/24. They expect to receive payments as early as November, but just to be sure they put December in order not to get into trouble right away
